result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Clifford Paul Bergemann was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay fine, costs, and DNA surcharge.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Submit a DNA sample, if not done already.

timeConds.notes:
Can be served in in Waushara County. Report immediately. Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Consecutive to: to sentence currently serving

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Clifford Paul Bergemann
Current: 638 Central Street, Room 10, Oshkosh, WI 54901 United States  (Effective: 06-15-2018)
Prior: 638 Central Street, Oshkosh, WI 54901 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Clifford Paul Bergemann
Current: 638 Central Street, Oshkosh, WI 54901 United States  (Effective: 06-15-2018)
Prior: 1709 S 8th Street, Apt. 4, Milwaukee, WI 53204

2:01 p.m. This a Blessinger Hearing for a Committment Warrant that was issued for failure to pay fines, fees, or costs that were previously ordered by the Court.  
Court Case(s) #: 15CF268
The defendant appears by video.
Court swears in the defendant.
Court questions the Defendant as to his reasons for failing to pay and his financial status.
Defendant makes statements.
Court continues to question defendant.

Court informs the Defendant that serving time in jail will not reduce or eliminate the fine.

BY THE COURT: 
There were times when the defendant was able to pay and was not incarcerated. 
Defendant is to be released and set up a payment plan
Court orders a payment plan set at $100.00 per month beginning July 10, 2018 and the 10th of each month thereafter until paid in full.
from the defendant dated 04/22/18 in re:  payment of outstanding fines/costs
Warrant delivered to dispatch by Court Officer

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Clifford Paul Bergemann in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Defendant Clifford Paul Bergemann in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case 15CF268 is set for initial. 15CM94, 14CT222, 15CM11, 14CM494, and 15CM78 are set for plea hearings.
ADA Knaapen informs the Court that 14CT222(OWI 4th) is to be dismissed and is now filed as 15CF268 (OWI 5th).
BTC: 14CT222 is Dismissed.

15CF268 Initial Appearance held, waived reading of complaint. 
Waived Preliminary Hearing and Court finds the Defendant freely & voluntarily waives hearing and finds probable cause and binds over. 
Arraignment held. Information filed and waived reading.

Plea hearings on 15CF268 Count 1 (OWI 5th), 15CM94 Count 1 (Bail Jumping), and 15CM11 Count 1 (Bail Jumping).
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF268 Count 1: No Contest
15CM11 Count 1: No Contest
15CM94 Count 1: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty15CF268 Count 1, 15CM11 Count 1,  and 15CM94 Count 1:.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 15CF268 Count 2 is dismissed, 15CM94 Cts 2 & 3, 15CM11 Ct 2, 14CM494, and 15CM78 are Dismissed Read In.  Bonds are revoked.

ADA Knaapen makes joint sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkely concurs and makes sentencing arguments to the Court and request jail to be served in Waushara County. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF268 Count 1 - OWI 5th: Imposed & stayed Sentence:  Prison 2 yrs Incarcerated & 2 yrs Extended Supervision - stayed
24 mo Probation:
Conditional 180 days jail, consecutive to sentence currently serving, 20 days credit, can be served in in Waushara County w/huber. Report immediately
$1,200 + costs + DNA surcharge ($250).
Provide a DNA Sample, if not done already.
$26.45 Blood Draw costs
36 mo Revocation
36 mo IID
DOT/AODA Assessment

15CM11 Count 1: 60 days jail, consecutive. Pay costs. 16 days credit.

15CM94 Count 1: 60 days jail, consecutive. Pay costs. 49 days credit.
